snippet: The arrest of a factory worker illustrates a feverish campaign to protect the monarchy and rebuff critics of Thailand’s military rulers.
abstract: Thai military court charges factory worker with insulting King Bhumibol Adulyadej's dog in social media posts; suspect faces possible sentence of 37 years, reflecting expansion of  laws aimed at restricting criticism of monarchy; United States ambassador to Thailand is also being investigated for questioning length of sentences for such offenses.
lead_paragraph: The arrest of a factory worker illustrates a feverish campaign to protect the monarchy and rebuff critics of Thailand’s military rulers.

headline.main: Thai Man May Go to Prison for Insulting King’s Dog
headline.print_headline: Thai Man Faces Prison for Insulting Royal Dog

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
